title.narrative: Second Lower Secondary Education for the Most Disadvantaged Areas Project

description.narrative: The project is a continuation of the first Lower Secondary Education for the Most Disadvantaged Regions Project, which has been successfully implemented and will be completed by the end of 2014. 2 The second project will help the Government of Viet Nam assist the poor and near-poor through the enhancement of lower secondary education (LSE), which contributes to an expansion of opportunities.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
33,000 teacher and managers trained (16,500 female and 16,500 male).

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.

title.narrative: At least 29,700 more students accommodated (14,850 female and 14,850 male), and 3,780 accommodated in semi-boarding facilities (1,890 female and 1,890 male).

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.

title.narrative: At least 640,000 students educated under the improved quality assurance system (320,000 female and 320,000 male).

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.

title.narrative: NER for ethnic minority students in the target provinces increased by 8 percentage points (SY2012/13 baseline: 48%).

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.

title.narrative: Gender gaps among enrolled ethnic minority students in the target provinces decreased to 4.0% (SY2012/13 baseline: 9.4% with male 54.7% and female 45.3%).

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.

title.narrative: By SY2020 (for all indicators): NER increased by 5 percentage point for each area (SY2012/13 baseline: northern midland and mountainous areas 77.1%, central highlands 77.7%, Mekong River Delta 73.3%, and north central and central coastal areas 84.7%) for male and female (SY2012/13 baseline: female NER northern midland and mountainous areas 81.8%, central highlands area 80.8%, Mekong River Delta 72.9%, and north central and central coastal areas 93.5%).

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.

title.narrative: Dropout rate in target areas lowered to less than 1.0% in the target areas (for male and female students) (SY2012/13 baseline: total 1.8% and female 1.6%).

description.narrative: More equitable access and retention of ethnic minorities, girls, and disadvantaged children in LSSs in northern midland and mountainous areas, central highlands, Mekong River Delta, and north central and central coastal areas, which are frequently affected by typhoons.
